Author: smashing_hashing
Text: So as far as like, sports nutrition science goes, it really doesn't matter whether you eat all day or once a day. The real important factor is overall intake in any given ~24 hr period.  I'm on mobile rn but there are studies showing that muscle growth in bodybuilders was about the same regardless of meal timing.  This destroys the common bro-science theory that one must chug a protein shake every 2 hours to avoid going catabolic.  At the end of the day, meal timing should be organized in whatever manner is most likely to help you adhere to whatever dietary goals you have. Use meal timing as a tool rather than an obligation that must be met.  Personally, that means I save most of my calories for right before bed. I'll usually eat like 500 calories of lean chicken, cheese, and broccoli for a late dinner. It works for me.

Author: kenodhagxjah
Text: having the food spread out throughout the day has helped me loads.. because you get hungry at night, make sure to eat more in the evening/last meal. e.g u can eat 150 for earlier in the day, like breakfast, then 150 for lunch and 300 in the evening, so it will make you much more full for the night, and maybe reduce your cravings.
